location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 5: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell issues the following instructions to John Patterson Porter: upon his arrival at Mohumrah [Khorramshahr], Porter should direct the HC schooner Mahito proceed to Bahrein [Bahrain] with instructions for the Commander of the HC brig of war Euphratesto quit that station and return to Bushire. Hennell suggests that the schooner should then proceed to Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi] in order to meet with Sheik Saeed ben Tahnoon [Sheikh Said bin Tahnun Al Nahayan] and negotiate the return of a slave who was seized at sea from a Debaye [Dubai] boat by some of his people.
